raw_comment:
I notice that compared to players of color, there are far less head coaches of color. Especially in football where 74% of the NFL is made up of player of color and only 13% of the NFL head coaches are people of color.

I wonder what percent of the staff on these major sports leagues such as assistant managers, coaches, nutritionist, etc. are people of color?

This impacts my community because for awhile now we've seen people of color excel at sports. However, it is just as important people of color have the opportunity to be coaching staff and be involved in more ways than just being players. If teams utilize people of color to play for their teams and win games, they should have just as much respect for people of color when it comes to hiring coaching staff.

Diversity in major sports leagues off the field.
ace_sentences: I notice that there are fewer head coaches of color than players of color.

In football, 13 percent of NFL head coaches are people of color.
I wonder what percent of staff in major sports leagues are people of color.
Assistant managers are staff in major sports leagues.
Coaches are staff in major sports leagues.
Nutritionists are staff in major sports leagues.
For a while, people of color have excelled at sports.
It is important that people of color have the opportunity to be coaching staff.
It is important that people of color are involved in sports in ways other than being players.
Some teams use people of color as players.
If a team uses people of color as players, then the team should respect people of color in hiring coaching staff.
The headline is: Diversity in major sports leagues off the field.
